children.name: Privacy Policy
Privacy Policy
Version 1.0 Last updated 8th January 2024

1. Introduction Welcome to the PlannerPal Privacy Policy by Morrow Choice Limited. PlannerPal is a trading name of Morrow Choice Ltd. We are committed to protecting your privacy in compliance with the UK GDPR and Data Protection Act 2018. This policy explains how we collect, process, and secure your data. It covers your rights, legal protection, and our employees' obligations.
Introduction

Welcome to the PlannerPal Privacy Policy by Morrow Choice Limited. PlannerPal is a trading name of Morrow Choice Ltd. We are committed to protecting your privacy in compliance with the UK GDPR and Data Protection Act 2018. This policy explains how we collect, process, and secure your data. It covers your rights, legal protection, and our employees' obligations.

2. Our Customers Our Customers consists of Independent Financial Advisors (IFAs), individual advisers, wealth managers, adviser firms, and various firms within the financial services sector. This encompasses any individuals within these organisations with whom we may need to initiate contact or uphold a relationship. The term client(s) relates to the clients of these firms, whose data our Customers will be uploading into the PlannerPal Tool as per the User Terms. We serve as the Data Controller for our Customer(s) Data and the Data Processor for our Customers' client data. As of now, in accordance with GDPR requirements, there is no obligation for us to designate a data protection officer, and we have not chosen to appoint one voluntarily at this time. For inquiries, contact us at team@plannerpal.co.uk or The Core Bath Lane, Newcastle Helix, Newcastle Upon Tyne, NE4 5TF, UK.
Our Customers

Our Customers consists of Independent Financial Advisors (IFAs), individual advisers, wealth managers, adviser firms, and various firms within the financial services sector. This encompasses any individuals within these organisations with whom we may need to initiate contact or uphold a relationship. The term client(s) relates to the clients of these firms, whose data our Customers will be uploading into the PlannerPal Tool as per the User Terms. We serve as the Data Controller for our Customer(s) Data and the Data Processor for our Customers' client data. As of now, in accordance with GDPR requirements, there is no obligation for us to designate a data protection officer, and we have not chosen to appoint one voluntarily at this time. For inquiries, contact us at
team@plannerpal.co.uk
team@plannerpal.co.uk
or The Core Bath Lane, Newcastle Helix, Newcastle Upon Tyne, NE4 5TF, UK.
3. Definition & Responsibilities
Definition & Responsibilities

• Data Processor: Processes personal data on behalf of the Data Controller. Processes data based on the controller's instructions, implements security measures, and assists the controller in fulfilling its obligations. For the avoidance of doubt, we are Data Processor for the underlying client data supplied to us by our Customers and Customer Firms that use our PlannerPal Tool.
Data Processor

: Processes personal data on behalf of the Data Controller. Processes data based on the controller's instructions, implements security measures, and assists the controller in fulfilling its obligations. For the avoidance of doubt, we are Data Processor for the underlying client data supplied to us by our Customers and Customer Firms that use our PlannerPal Tool.

• Data Controller: Determines the purposes and means of processing personal data. Controls how and why data is processed, makes decisions about data collection, storage, and use. For the avoidance of doubt, we are ONLY a Data Controller for information about our Customers where we use that information for our own business purposes. We follow GDPR guidelines, ensuring confidentiality, security, and cooperation with audits and any legal or regulatory requests.
Data Controller

: Determines the purposes and means of processing personal data. Controls how and why data is processed, makes decisions about data collection, storage, and use. For the avoidance of doubt, we are ONLY a Data Controller for information about our Customers where we use that information for our own business purposes. We follow GDPR guidelines, ensuring confidentiality, security, and cooperation with audits and any legal or regulatory requests.

4. Types of Data Collected & Consent You, as our Customer, may give us personal information thorough the Tool, email, or phone call. This includes information you provide when you use PlannerPal; apply to use the service, search our website, enter a promotion, take part in a survey, or when interacting with our Tool or website in any other way. This also includes any occasions when you report a problem with the Tool or the website. When giving us personal information about third parties, your clients, you confirm that you are entitled to disclose that information and that you have proper legal basis and their consent and authority to do so, and they understand that PlannerPal will process their personal details as shown in section 6 ‘How we Use Your Personal Data’. We do not collect sensitive data (e.g. race, health, sexual orientation, religion) or criminal information from our Customers.
Types of Data Collected & Consent

You, as our Customer, may give us personal information thorough the Tool, email, or phone call. This includes information you provide when you use PlannerPal; apply to use the service, search our website, enter a promotion, take part in a survey, or when interacting with our Tool or website in any other way. This also includes any occasions when you report a problem with the Tool or the website. When giving us personal information about third parties, your clients, you confirm that you are entitled to disclose that information and that you have proper legal basis and their consent and authority to do so, and they understand that PlannerPal will process their personal details as shown in section 6 ‘How we Use Your Personal Data’. We do not collect sensitive data (e.g. race, health, sexual orientation, religion) or criminal information from our Customers.
5. Legal Basis for Collection
Legal Basis for Collection

• Consent: Obtained when you agree to receive newsletters or opt-in to a marketing service. The User Terms provide legitimate consent to contact you about material matters relating to the performance of our services.
Consent

: Obtained when you agree to receive newsletters or opt-in to a marketing service. The User Terms provide legitimate consent to contact you about material matters relating to the performance of our services.
• Contractual Obligations: Required to fulfil our service promises.
Contractual Obligations
: Required to fulfil our service promises.
• Legal Compliance: Necessary for fraud prevention and legal obligations.
Legal Compliance
: Necessary for fraud prevention and legal obligations.
• Legitimate Interest: Collecting data essential for business operations and providing our services to you.
Legitimate Interest
: Collecting data essential for business operations and providing our services to you.

Receiving Communications

Change of Purpose

7. Your Rights and How You Are Protected: You have rights regarding your personal data, including access, correction, deletion, objection, and data portability. Contact us to exercise these rights.
Your Rights and How You Are Protected: You have rights regarding your personal data, including access, correction, deletion, objection, and data portability. Contact us to exercise these rights.
• Right to be Informed: You have the right to know why and how we use your personal data, how long we keep it, and who we share it with. This information is provided in this policy.
Right to be Informed: You have the right to know why and how we use your personal data, how long we keep it, and who we share it with. This information is provided in this policy.

• Right of Access: You can ask for a copy of your personal data and check if we are processing it lawfully. This is known as a "data subject access request." Details on making this request are in the section ‘Data Access Request Process’.

Right of Access: You can ask for a copy of your personal data and check if we are processing it lawfully. This is known as a "data subject access request." Details on making this request are in the section ‘Data Access Request Process’.
• Right to Rectification: You can request corrections to your personal data. If we have incomplete or inaccurate data, we'll correct it, though we might need to verify new information you provide.
Right to Rectification: You can request corrections to your personal data. If we have incomplete or inaccurate data, we'll correct it, though we might need to verify new information you provide.

• Right to Erasure: You can ask us to delete or remove your personal data if there's no good reason for us to keep processing it. However, legal reasons may prevent us from erasing it, and we'll notify you if applicable.

Right to Erasure: You can ask us to delete or remove your personal data if there's no good reason for us to keep processing it. However, legal reasons may prevent us from erasing it, and we'll notify you if applicable.

• Right to Object: You can object to the processing of your personal data, especially in cases like direct marketing or when we rely on legitimate interests. It's not an absolute right and depends on specific circumstances, please talk to us if you wish to prevent us from using elements of personal data.

Right to Object: You can object to the processing of your personal data, especially in cases like direct marketing or when we rely on legitimate interests. It's not an absolute right and depends on specific circumstances, please talk to us if you wish to prevent us from using elements of personal data.

• Right to Restrict Processing: You can request the restriction or suppression of your personal data in certain situations, like ensuring its accuracy, preventing erasure when it's still needed, or during verification after an objection, please talk to us if you wish to restrict or supresses elements of personal data.

Right to Restrict Processing: You can request the restriction or suppression of your personal data in certain situations, like ensuring its accuracy, preventing erasure when it's still needed, or during verification after an objection, please talk to us if you wish to restrict or supresses elements of personal data.

• Right to Data Portability: You can request the transfer of your personal data to yourself or a third party. We'll provide it in a structured, commonly used, machine-readable format. This right applies to automated information you initially consented to, or data used for a contract.

Right to Data Portability: You can request the transfer of your personal data to yourself or a third party. We'll provide it in a structured, commonly used, machine-readable format. This right applies to automated information you initially consented to, or data used for a contract.

• Right to not be subject to a decision based solely on automated processing: We do not use data to enable any automated decisions, including profiling, and as such this right specifically is not applicable.

Right to not be subject to a decision based solely on automated processing: We do not use data to enable any automated decisions, including profiling, and as such this right specifically is not applicable.
If you want to exercise any of these rights, contact us at
team@plannerpal.co.uk
team@plannerpal.co.uk
Control Over Your Data
: You can delete your account anytime, ensuring the removal of all stored data. Account information is password-protected for your privacy and security. Please contact us should you wish to do this.
Data Security

: While we take measures to secure your data and we operate a two- factor authentication process to help keep your account secure, internet transmissions aren't guaranteed to be completely secure. You need to prevent unauthorised access to your account and any personal information by protecting your password, computer and smart device access, and log-in credential. Contact us if you suspect any security issues.
Opting Out of Marketing

: If you have opted in for receipt of marketing communications, you can stop receiving messages by contacting us. Other personal data unrelated to marketing preferences will still be retained and you have the right to ask us to not process, share or transfer your personal data for this purpose.
Data Access Request Process

: Accessing your data is fee-free. We may need identity verification for security, and we have the right to refuse your request as a security measure, we may also contact you to speed up our response to such requests.

8. Your Data and Third Parties We may share non-personal data with third parties, and in certain business situations, personal data may be shared with subcontractors, data software providers, regulatory and tax authorities, fraud prevention agencies or affiliates. If we use subcontractors to store your data, we ensure that we retain control and prevent exposure to security risks we may also use analytics and search engine providers that assist us in improving and optimising the website or Tool. It’s important to note that no transmission of data over the internet or email is entirely secure. While we make every effort to protect personal data, there's a possibility that third parties beyond our control could unlawfully intercept or access transmissions. We cannot guarantee the absolute security of any personal data you transmit to us. Any transmissions are at your own risk. If you ever feel that your interaction with us is no longer secure, please notify us immediately. Additionally, your personal information may be shared with third parties in the following situations:

Your Data and Third Parties We may share non-personal data with third parties, and in certain business situations, personal data may be shared with subcontractors, data software providers, regulatory and tax authorities, fraud prevention agencies or affiliates. If we use subcontractors to store your data, we ensure that we retain control and prevent exposure to security risks we may also use analytics and search engine providers that assist us in improving and optimising the website or Tool. It’s important to note that no transmission of data over the internet or email is entirely secure. While we make every effort to protect personal data, there's a possibility that third parties beyond our control could unlawfully intercept or access transmissions. We cannot guarantee the absolute security of any personal data you transmit to us. Any transmissions are at your own risk. If you ever feel that your interaction with us is no longer secure, please notify us immediately. Additionally, your personal information may be shared with third parties in the following situations:
• In the event of a business sale or acquisition, where we may disclose your data to the prospective seller or buyer.
In the event of a business sale or acquisition, where we may disclose your data to the prospective seller or buyer.

• When required to comply with a legal obligation or enforce our rights under this policy, User Terms, or other agreements. This may also involve sharing information with other companies and organisations for fraud protection and credit risk reduction, ensuring the rights, property, and safety of our, customers, and others are safeguarded. The same applies if we license our technology.

When required to comply with a legal obligation or enforce our rights under this policy, User Terms, or other agreements. This may also involve sharing information with other companies and organisations for fraud protection and credit risk reduction, ensuring the rights, property, and safety of our, customers, and others are safeguarded. The same applies if we license our technology.

• If we sell the company or its assets, we may decide to transfer, sell, or assign your personal data to a third party. In such cases, the acquiring entity's privacy policy will govern the data's further use. In all other situations, your data will remain protected as outlined in our Privacy Policy.

If we sell the company or its assets, we may decide to transfer, sell, or assign your personal data to a third party. In such cases, the acquiring entity's privacy policy will govern the data's further use. In all other situations, your data will remain protected as outlined in our Privacy Policy.

9. Data Retention We will keep your personal data only for as long as needed to fulfil the purposes for which we collected it and the duration of your relationship with us. In certain situations, such as handling complaints or anticipating potential litigation or for regulatory purposes like anti-money laundering checks related to our relationship with you, we may retain your personal data for a longer duration than usual.

Data Retention We will keep your personal data only for as long as needed to fulfil the purposes for which we collected it and the duration of your relationship with us. In certain situations, such as handling complaints or anticipating potential litigation or for regulatory purposes like anti-money laundering checks related to our relationship with you, we may retain your personal data for a longer duration than usual.
10. Age Limit Users must be 18 or older; our services are not intended for children, and we do not knowingly collect data relating to children.
Age Limit Users must be 18 or older; our services are not intended for children, and we do not knowingly collect data relating to children.

11. How we Store and Protect Your Data and International Data Storage: Your data will be stored in AWS in the UK. However, there will be instances where the data collected from you is transferred to, and stored at, a location outside these regions. It might also be processed by staff operating outside these areas, either employed by us or our suppliers. This processing is necessary for our services, payment processing, and support services. By submitting your personal data, you consent to this transfer, storage, or processing. Please ask us for further details. We take all reasonable steps to ensure that your data is treated securely and in line with this privacy policy. All information you provide is stored on secure cloud servers. If you have a password for accessing specific parts of the website or app, it's your responsibility to keep it confidential. While we employ strict procedures and security features upon receiving your information to prevent unauthorised access, it's important to note that sending information over the internet carries inherent risks. Despite our best efforts to protect your personal data, we cannot guarantee its security during transmission to the website or app, and it is done at your own risk. We strongly recommend purchasing and maintaining up-to-date software to enhance the security of your mobile device. By using our services, you are consenting to the transfer of information, including Personal Data, outside of the UK and European countries. You can ask us for information on the safeguard that we use when your personal data is transferred outside of the UK & European Union.

How we Store and Protect Your Data and International Data Storage: Your data will be stored in AWS in the UK. You can ask us for information on the safeguard that we use when your personal data is transferred outside of the UK & European Union.

12. Information we receive from third party platforms: When you connect third party platforms, apps or providers to our Services (e.g. Microsoft, Zoom), we receive certain Personal Information that includes your username, email address, details of files held on those systems that you are choosing to share with us (e.g. recordings of Microsoft Teams calls or Zoom calls, files held in Microsoft SharePoint folders).

Information we receive from third party platforms: When you connect third party platforms, apps or providers to our Services (e.g. Microsoft, Zoom), we receive certain Personal Information that includes your username, email address, details of files held on those systems that you are choosing to share with us (e.g. recordings of Microsoft Teams calls or Zoom calls, files held in Microsoft SharePoint folders).

13. Policy Changes: We regularly review our Privacy Policy and will post any updates here, so please check back regularly. When using our services, you consent to the collection and use of data by us as outlined in this Privacy Policy. Continued access or use of our services will signify your explicit acceptance of any changes made to this Privacy Policy.

Policy Changes: We regularly review our Privacy Policy and will post any updates here, so please check back regularly. When using our services, you consent to the collection and use of data by us as outlined in this Privacy Policy. Continued access or use of our services will signify your explicit acceptance of any changes made to this Privacy Policy.

14. How to make a complaint if things go wrong If you have concerns about how we are processing your personal information, please contact us to help resolve any issues, although you have the right to complain to the Information Commissioner’s Office (ICO) at www.ico.org.uk. at any time.

How to make a complaint if things go wrong If you have concerns about how we are processing your personal information, please contact us to help resolve any issues, although you have the right to complain to the Information Commissioner’s Office (ICO) at
www.ico.org.uk
www.ico.org.uk
. at any time.

15. Cookies We use cookies to authenticate users to ensure that only an actual owner of an account can access that account. Cookies also help us to improve your experience when you browse our website or use our Tool.

Cookies We use cookies to authenticate users to ensure that only an actual owner of an account can access that account. Cookies also help us to improve your experience when you browse our website or use our Tool.

16. Interpretation: “Client(s)” the clients of you, the Customer, whose data you’ll be uploading to the PlannerPal Tool for transcription services analysis and reporting and from whom you have obtained authorisation and consent and have legal basis to use their data. “Hybrid Paraplanner Service” An advanced offering addressing more complex document needs through a web dashboard and PlannerPal. This service integrates AI efficiency with human paraplanner expertise, ensuring top-tier quality for complex financial documents. “PlannerPal” is the designated trade name of Morrow Choice Limited, used as the official name for the Tool presentation and provision. “PlannerPal Tool” means all the information, reports, data uploads and analysis, and data accessed, uploaded and summary reports generated using AI or machine learning. “Tool” is the transcription PlannerPal Tool available for download on the App Store or accessible through our website (www.plannerpal.co.uk). Upon downloading, users are subject to the terms specified in the User Terms. "UK GDPR" means the EU GDPR as transposed into UK law (including by the Data Protection Act 2018 and the Data Protection, Privacy and Electronic Communications (Amendments etc) (EU Exit) Regulations 2019) and all other UK laws regulating the processing of Personal Data, as such laws may be updated, amended and superseded from time to time. “User Terms” the terms that every individual using PlannerPal will need to accept upon use. “We”, “Us” or “Our” - when we say "we" or "us" “our” we mean PlannerPal, the trading name of the Company providing you access to the tool. “You”, “Your(s)” or the “Customer” refers to you, the Company who signs up to our terms and the Users who agree to the User Terms.
